mentor.advantage: +1 die for compiling and registering sprites of any type
mentor.disadvantage: Zero-One is the perfection of the code and demands the same from his followers, or at least teaches them a harsh lesson if they fail. Zero-One technomancers must spend 2 points of Edge to negate a glitch or downgrade a critical glitch.

mentor.name: Alias
mentor.disadvantage: Alias technomancers cannot abide to pay for their lifestyle and must therefore use their abilities to spoof their lifestyle.

mentor.name: Abort
mentor.disadvantage: An Abort technomancer must make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to take any other action in cybercombat except for trying to crash his opponent’s software.

mentor.name: Archivist
mentor.disadvantage: Technomancers following the Archivist cannot willingly destroy or corrupt data. The technomancer must succeed at a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to purposely delete or corrupt data (or order a sprite to do so).

mentor.name: Architect
mentor.disadvantage: –1 die to Crash Tests

mentor.name: Babel
mentor.advantage: +1 to online Etiquette and Language Tests, +1 die for Courier or Tutor sprites (player must choose one)
mentor.disadvantage: Secrecy is the bane of communication, so Babel technomancers must make a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to encrypt anything.

mentor.name: The Black Hat
mentor.disadvantage: Black Hat technomancers have extreme difficulty restraining themselves from hacking into a node that is interesting in any way. The technomancer must succeed in a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to avoid hacking such a system when the opportunity arises.

mentor.name: Cryptome
mentor.advantage: +2 dice to all Encryption and Decryption Tests
mentor.disadvantage: Technomancers who follow Cryptome don’t surrender secrets easily and never to unreliable sources. The technomancer must make a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to share a secret or important information with someone he does not completely trust … and such trust is rare.

mentor.name: Daedalus
mentor.disadvantage: Technomancers who follow Daedalus tend to interact with the machines on which they are working in an even more subconscious manner than usual. As a result, modifications they make are geared towards someone with their talents and worldview, rather than something that is intuitive to a mundane user or even a non-Daedalus technomancer. Devices built or modified by such technomancers have a more arcane user interface, imposing a –2 modifier on anyone who wants to legitimately use it.

mentor.name: Delphi
mentor.disadvantage: Delphi technomancers don’t adapt easily to unexpected situations. They must make a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to make any quick decisions in situations they have not planned for.

mentor.name: Disinformation
mentor.advantage: +1 die to all test with skills from the Influence skill group
mentor.disadvantage: Disinformants must succeed in a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to pass truthful, complete, or non-doctored information via the Matrix to non-dissonant technomancers.

mentor.name: Echelon
mentor.advantage: +1 die to Track and Sniffer Tests
mentor.disadvantage: Echelon followers obsessively work to gather information about what is going on around them. When caught off-guard, without having information they need, or when running blind into a situation, they suffer a –1 dice pool modifier on all actions as long as the situation remains.

mentor.name: Flow
mentor.disadvantage: –1 die to Cybercombat Attack Tests

mentor.name: Idoru
mentor.disadvantage: Idoru followers must succeed in a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to avoid manipulating data in their favor when the opportunity affords.

mentor.name: Intrusion Countermeasure (IC)
mentor.advantage: +2 dice to all Matrix Damage Resistance Tests except Fading, +1 die for Paladin sprites
mentor.disadvantage: If an IC technomancer fails to protect or guard something he has committed to, or does not achieve a self-chosen goal, he suffers a –1 dice pool modifier on all actions until he atones for the failure.

mentor.name: Jormungand
mentor.disadvantage: Jormungand technomancers are destructive and will take every opportunity to devastate a node by permanently deleting or corrupting its data. They must succeed in a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to leave a node they have hacked into unscathed.

mentor.name: Nemesis
mentor.disadvantage: A Nemesis technomancer must make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to restrain himself from punishing those whom he feels deserve it.

mentor.name: Noise
mentor.disadvantage: Noise technomancers rely on the buzz of Matrix more so than others, and suffer double the modifiers applied to Matrix and non-Matrix actions when caught in static or dead zones (see p. 210, SR4).

mentor.name: Probe
mentor.disadvantage: Probe technomancers receive a –2 dice penalty when hacking on the fly without probing first.

mentor.name: Pulse
mentor.disadvantage: –2 dice on Hacking Tests when not hacking on the fly

mentor.name: Shooter
mentor.advantage: +2 dice to all Matrix Attack Tests
mentor.disadvantage: A Shooter technomancer must succeed in a Willpower + Logic (3) Test to retreat from a Matrix fight.

mentor.name: Snuff
mentor.disadvantage: Snuff technomancer suffer a –2 dice pool modifier to resisting addiction to BTL or Matrix media.

mentor.name: Tiamat
mentor.disadvantage: –1 die to all Hacking Tests

mentor.name: The World Tree
mentor.disadvantage: World Tree technomancers are easily distracted by information they find interesting. When faced with new information, unusual data, or phenomena, the technomancer must make a Willpower + Charisma (3) Test to resist dropping his current task to screen, analyze, and acquire the information (if possible).
